intro: Epidendrum hololeucum, commonly known as the white-flowered epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its long, pendant inflorescences that bear numerous white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质, providing structural support and efficient water retention. Epidendrum hololeucum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is relatively easy to cultivate under the right conditions.
